message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.DS, cs.GT, cs.IT. 

The paper deals with a machine learning problem involving contextual bandits, which is a subfield of reinforcement learning and falls under the category of machine learning (cs.LG). The problem also involves optimization of a concave objective function, which is a common topic in artificial intelligence (cs.AI). The algorithms proposed in the paper are computationally efficient, which suggests that the paper may also belong to the category of data structures and algorithms (cs.DS). The problem involves competition with an arbitrary set of policies, which is a game-theoretic concept and may place the paper under the category of game theory (cs.GT). Finally, the paper involves information theory concepts such as regret bounds, which may also place it under the category of information theory (cs.IT).
